title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, the top 2026 NFL Draft prospect, expressed eagerness to be mentored by Tom Brady if drafted by the Raiders.
Mendoza, with an impressive 2025 season at Indiana, completed a pre-draft interview with the Tom Brady minority-owned Las Vegas Raiders.
Despite being a favorite for the No. 1 draft pick, Mendoza remains open to being selected by any NFL team.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman', starring Jennifer Lopez, is streaming on Hulu. The movie adapts the Tony Award-winning musical.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run', a documentary on the Beatles icon, is directed by Morgan Neville, available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4, featuring a narrative around Benedict Bridgerton, is streaming on Netflix with a focus on romantic intrigue.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game but were able to continue playing.
Both players were checked by trainers and recorded hits later in the game against the Braves.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication while tracking a fly ball, leading to minor injuries.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund when a player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation marks his largest public pledge to the Jimmy Fund, supporting Boston's Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
Cora previously linked donations to Red Sox performance, giving based on wins and runs during the 2021 season.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act 184-164, aimed at regulating teachings on race and LGBTQ+ in schools.
The bill prohibits instruction that fosters division or promotes anti-constitutional indoctrination, emphasizing neutral or patriotic education.
Violations under the bill could lead to teacher discipline or lawsuits against schools, involving fines up to $10,000.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2's Hairpin Turn are created by adding food coloring to the ice.
The tradition of coloring ice in North Adams has existed for decades and involves locals using water balloons.
The Hairpin Turn on the Mohawk Trail offers views of Hoosac Valley and is near attractions like MASS MoCA.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts reports first measles cases of 2026 involving a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The adult returned from abroad with an unclear vaccination history and likely exposed others to the virus.
The U.S. is experiencing a large measles outbreak with 1,136 cases in 2026, but Massachusetts risk remains low.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
Morgan was known for her community involvement, notably appearing in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial with Rob Gronkowski.
She is survived by her husband, Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and numerous family members and friends.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Hamilton's father, a former Boston salesman, died of ALS; she aims to raise awareness and honor his legacy.
The Boston Marathon run symbolizes hope and a future fight against ALS for Hamilton and other affected families.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion to the Supreme Judicial Court after AG Andrea Campbell moved to dismiss her lawsuit.
The lawsuit aims to compel Massachusetts legislative leaders to comply with a state audit approved by voters 15 months ago.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio's lawsuit lacks authority, while legislative leaders claim the audit could violate state law separation of powers.
